author: BBC News
description:
More than 10 months after the fall of Syria’s President Bashar al-Assad the country is still uncovering the horrors of the past. More than 181,000 people are unaccounted for after 14 years of civil war.  Mass graves are still being uncovered and the families of those killed or who disappeared are demanding answers. 

Syrian’s are gathering documentary evidence of the crimes of the Assad’s regime in the hope that those responsible can be brought to justice.   

They’re investigating the torture, executions and the arbitrary imprisonment of huge numbers of people.  Volunteers, including victims and their families, are determined to preserve the evidence needed to bring the perpetrators to account.

Sophie Raworth presents BBC News at Ten reporting by Orla Guerin in Syria.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Syrian families seek justice for dead and missing victims of Assad regime | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, the Climate Change Committee has sent a letter to the Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State saying the UK should have contingency plans in case the UK sees 2C of global warming by 2050. 

Adam Fleming speaks to Emma Pinchbeck, CEO of the Climate Change Committee.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #ClimateChange #Climate
title: What could the UK government do to prepare for hotter temperatures? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
title: OpenAI will soon allow erotica on ChatGPT, says boss Sam Altman. #OpenAI #SamAltman #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
More than 40 of sumo wrestling biggest stars are in London for a prestigious tournament.
 
The Grand Sumo Tournament is taking place outside of Japan for just the second time, with the competition taking place in London’s Royal Albert Hall from 15 October until 19 October.
 
Sumo has seen a significant rise in popularity among international fans in recent years, and a rare international tournament abroad is hoped to further boost the appeal of Japanese culture abroad.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Sumo #London #BBCNews
title: Why is a sumo tournament being held in London? | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Migrants will need A-level standard English to work in UK. #UK #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Pakistan and Afghanistan have agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire following days of cross-border fighting.
 
Fresh fighting broke out along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border early on Wednesday, with each side accusing the other of initiating deadly clashes.
 
Pakistan's military said its forces had killed "15-20 Afghan Taliban" and injured many in Spin Boldak border district.
 
A Taliban government spokesman said 12 Afghan civilians had been killed and more than 100 wounded by Pakistani firing. Numerous Pakistani soldiers had been killed, he added. None of the deaths could be independently confirmed.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Pakistan #Afghanistan #BBCNews
title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to 48-hour ceasefire after new clashes | BBC News

title: British influencer 'Big John' detained in Australia over visa. #Australia #BigJohn #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
The war in Gaza has had an enormous humanitarian impact, particularly on children.
 
The UN’s World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that 42,000 people in Gaza suffered life-changing injuries during the war, including 10,000 children.
 
This month, the WHO stressed the urgent need for fuel, medical supplies and call for medical evacuations to be prioritised.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Gaza #Children #BBCNews
title: UN estimates 42,000 adults and children in Gaza have life-changing injuries | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga has died at the age of 80, family sources have told the BBC.
 
Odinga died on Wednesday while receiving medical treatment at a hospital in India.
 
In recent weeks, there has been speculation about his health, although family members and political allies had dismissed reports suggesting he was critically ill.
 
Former President Uhuru Kenyatta said Odinga's death had "left a silence that echoes across our nation".
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Kenya #Africa #BBCNews
title: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga dies aged 80 | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump has said Hamas "are going to disarm," adding that "if they don't disarm, we will disarm them".
 
Trump's 20-point peace plan says Gaza will be demilitarised and all "military, terror and offensive infrastructure" will be destroyed.

As a part of the plan, Hamas was required to return all 48 remaining hostages - so far, all 20 living hostages and seven hostages' bodies have been returned.

The three other bodies were handed over on Tuesday. In response to delays in handing over bodies, Israel has threatened to restrict aid into Gaza and delay the reopening of the Rafah crossing
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Gaza #DonaldTrump #BBCNews
title: Donald Trump says if Hamas don't disarm, we will disarm them | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Palestinian prisoners and detainees released by Israel on Monday have been sharing their stories. 
 
The BBC's Middle East correspondent, Lucy Williamson, has worked with freelancers in Gaza to speak to them.
 
Photojournalist Shadi Abu Sido described returning to his family as "indescribable". 
 
He was one of almost 2,000 prisoners released and exchanged for Israeli hostages under the first phase of the ceasefire deal.
 
Elsewhere in Gaza, more aid is reportedly getting into the Strip with food becoming more accessible and prices dropping. 

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Gaza #BBCNews
title: Released Palestinian detainees share their stories as more aid allowed into Gaza | BBC News
